```{r, include=FALSE}
library(ggplot2)
```

```{r}
# Code to create your plot
g <- ggplot(data = data.frame(normals = rnorm(10))) +
geom_histogram(mapping = aes(x = normals))
# Code to save your plot
ggsave(plot = g,
filename = "filename.jpeg",
width = 6,
height = 4)
# Plots can be found here
getwd()
```

```{r}
head(iris)
q1 <- ggplot(iris, aes(x = Petal.Length, y = Petal.Width, shape = Species, color = Sepal.Length)) +
  geom_point(size = 3) +
  labs(
    title = "Iris Data Collected by Edgar Anderson (1936)",
    x = "Petal Length (cm)",
    y = "Petal Width (cm)",
    color = "Sepal Length (cm)",
    shape = "Species"
  ) +
  scale_x_continuous(limits = c(0, 8)) +
  scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0, 3))

ggsave(plot = q1,
filename = "petal-length-by-petal-width.jpeg",
width = 6,
height = 4)
```
